casebody.data:
Ida R. Gridley’s Appeal from Probate. First Judicial District. Appeal from an order and decree of the Court of Probate for the district of Southington, admitting to probate a certain written instrument as the last will of Horace Gridley of Southington, deceased, taken to the Superior Court in Hartford County and tried to the jury before George W. Wheeler, J.; verdict for the contestant, Ida R. Gridley, which the court upon motion set aside as against the evidence, and appeal by her for alleged error of the court in so doing. Opinion filed with the clerk of the Superior Court, Hartford County. William F. Henney and Edward L. Smith, for the appellant (Ida R. Gridley). Cornelius J. Danaher, for the appéllee (the executor).

Argued May 7th

decided June 11th, 1902.

No error.
